Quotes.md
“The system must be considered as a whole, not merely in its parts.” – Claude Shannon.md
“Any difference that makes a difference can be a signal.” – Claude Shannon.md
“Perfect secrecy is obtained when the key is as long as the message and chosen at random.” – Claude Shannon.md
“We shall use the term ‘information’ to refer to the logarithm of the number of choices.” – Claude Shannon.md
“The significant aspect is that the actual message is one selected from a set of possible messages.” – Claude Shannon.md
“Entropy is a measure of the uncertainty in a random variable.” – Claude Shannon.md
“We now consider the problem of transmitting information over a noisy channel.” – Claude Shannon.md
The significant aspect is that the actual message is one selected from a set of possible messages..md
“Noise becomes meaningful when it selects against a message.” – Claude Shannon.md
“The fundamental problem of communication is reproducing at one point a message selected at another.” – Claude Shannon.md
“Information is the resolution of uncertainty.” – Claude Shannon.md
“Coding is the structure through which uncertainty becomes control.” – Claude Shannon.md
“Mathematics is the language nature uses to hide her secrets.” – Richard Feynman.md
“Understanding is a series of renamings until reality stops resisting.” – Richard Feynman.md
“The act of observation changes the observed.” – Werner Heisenberg.md
“Collapse is not destruction. It is decision.” – Erwin Schrödinger.md
“The significant aspect is not the actual content, but the selection of possibilities.” – Claude Shannon.md
“Quantum computing is not about speed. It’s about parallelism with structure.” – John Preskill.md
“The fundamental problem of communication is that of reproducing at one point either exactly or approximately a message selected at another point.” – Claude Shannon.md
We now consider the problem of transmitting information over a noisy channel..md
